trigger: The functional synergy between IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> involves p38 mitogen - activated protein kinase and is associated with the augmentation of STAT serine phosphorylation .

IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can stimulate mitogen - or CD3 - activated T cells to proliferate , produce <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and kill tumor cells .
The magnitude of these functional responses is greatly augmented when T cells are activated by the combination of IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Although peripheral blood T cells are largely unresponsive to these cytokines without prior activation , a small subset of <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells ( <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + CD18bright ) is strongly activated by the combination of IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In this report we show that the functional synergy between IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + CD18bright T cells correlates with the activation of the stress kinases , p38 mitogen - activated protein ( MAP ) kinase and stress - activated protein kinase ( SAPK ) / Jun N-terminal kinase , but not with the activation of the extracellular signal - regulated kinases .

The functional synergy between <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and IL-12 is also associated with a prominent increase in <extra_id_0> STAT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> serine phosphorylation over that observed with IL-12 or <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone .
By contrast , STAT tyrosine phosphorylation is not augmented over that seen with either cytokine alone .

A specific inhibitor of p38 MAP kinase completely inhibits the serine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> STAT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced by IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and abrogates the functional synergy between IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> without affecting STAT tyrosine phosphorylation .

This suggests that p38 MAP kinase may play an important role in regulating STAT serine phosphorylation in response to the combination of IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Furthermore , these findings indicate that the optimal activation of T cells by IL-12 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may depend on an interaction between the p38 MAP kinase and Janus kinase / STAT signaling pathways .
